etymology.description: 抱(抱) (bào, "hold") and 歉(歉) (qiàn, "apology") form a phrase expressing regret and a desire to hold or bear responsibility for a mistake or inconvenience.
etymology.interpretation: 抱歉(抱歉) (bàoqiàn, "sorry") is a common way to express an apology in Chinese, indicating a sense of regret or remorse. The combination of "hold" and "apology" conveys the notion of taking on the responsibility for causing discomfort or inconvenience.

examples.chinese: 我为迟到感到抱歉(我為遲到感到抱歉)，请原谅(請原諒)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ wèi chídào gǎndào bàoqiàn, qǐng yuánliàng.
examples.english: I apologize for being late, please forgive me.
